election_record.label: New Hampshire 1818 Governor

overview.note: Journal of the New Hampshire House of Representatives, Page 10 and New Hampshire Journal of the New Hampshire Senate, Page 9: "The committee have not included in the above estimate, the returns from the towns of Kingston, Wolfborough and Society-Land."

sub_unit.name: Danbury
sub_unit.note: The votes from Danbury were not included in the Original Election Returns.

sub_unit.name: Manchester
sub_unit.note: William Hale received 1 vote as William Hall.

sub_unit.name: New London
sub_unit.note: William Thompson received 47 votes as W. Thompson.

sub_unit.name: Society Land
sub_unit.note: Journal of the New Hampshire House of Representatives, Page 10 and New Hampshire Journal of the New Hampshire Senate, Page 9: "The return from Society-Land .... is not certified by the Town Clerk."

sub_unit.name: Warner
sub_unit.note: William Thompson received 18 votes as W. Thompson.

sub_unit.name: Rockingham
sub_unit.note: The Original Election Returns list William Hale with 1724 votes but the town totals add up to 1714.

sub_unit.name: Kingston
sub_unit.note: Journal of the New Hampshire House of Representatives, Page 10 and New Hampshire Journal of the New Hampshire Senate, Page 9: "The returns from Kingston, .... does not state that the votes were declared in open town meeting."

sub_unit.name: Northwood
sub_unit.note: The Oracle March 14, 1818 list 98 votes for William Plumer and 110 votes for William Hale.

sub_unit.name: Stratham
sub_unit.note: The Oracle March 14, 1818 list 7 votes for Henry Kenniston in town of Stratham.

sub_unit.name: Brookfield
sub_unit.note: George Sullivan received 47 votes as Hon. George.

sub_unit.name: Burton
sub_unit.note: Jeremiah Mason received 1 vote as Mason.

sub_unit.name: Rochester
sub_unit.note: William Hale received 5 votes as William P. Hale.

sub_unit.name: Sandwich
sub_unit.note: William Hale received 5 votes as William Hall.

sub_unit.name: Wolfeboro
sub_unit.note: Journal of the New Hampshire House of Representatives, Page 11 and New Hampshire Journal of the New Hampshire Senate, Page 10: "The return from Wolfborough .... does not state the day on which the meeting was holden."

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. New Hampshire Archives and Records Management, Concord.
